name: PDF to HTML Converter
description: Converts PDF documents to HTML format using pdf2htmlEX in Docker, preserving layout, fonts, and vector graphics.
author: AI Assistant

inputs.name: input_file
inputs.label: Upload PDF File
inputs.help: Select a PDF file to convert to HTML format

inputs.name: zoom
inputs.label: Zoom Level
inputs.help: Zoom level for better rendering quality (e.g., 1.0 = 100%, 1.3 = 130%)

inputs.name: embed_css
inputs.label: Embed CSS
inputs.help: Embed CSS styles in the HTML file for better portability

inputs.name: embed_javascript
inputs.label: Embed JavaScript
inputs.help: Embed JavaScript into the HTML file. Disabling this can reduce file size but may break functionality.

inputs.name: optimize_text
inputs.label: Optimize Text
inputs.help: Reduces the number of HTML elements used for text, which can significantly shrink file size.

inputs.name: embed_images
inputs.label: Embed Images
inputs.help: Embed images directly in the HTML file as base64 data

inputs.name: output_filename
inputs.label: Output Filename (optional)
inputs.help: Specify custom output filename. If empty, uses original PDF name with .html extension

inputs.name: font_format
inputs.label: Font Format
inputs.help: Font format used in the generated HTML.

inputs.name: printing
inputs.label: Printing Mode
inputs.help: Set to 1 to enable print-optimized output.

inputs.name: font_size_multiplier
inputs.label: Font Size Multiplier
inputs.help: Multiplier for font size precision in output rendering.

output.name: pdfToHtmlResult
output.description: The converted HTML file with conversion details and statistics.

file_path.description: Path to the converted HTML file

file_name.description: Name of the converted HTML file

conversion_details.description: Details about the conversion process including settings and statistics

docker_info.description: Information about the Docker container execution

external.name: pdf2htmlex-service
external.help: The pdf2htmlEX conversion service must be running via docker-compose. Start with: docker-compose up -d
